New Records: Adolis García set a record with 10 total bases in Game 7 and a record 15 RBIs in the series against the Houston Astros.
Key Match Events: Adolis García hit two homers and two singles in Game 7, producing five RBIs.
García hit a grand slam under immense pressure in Game 6.
The Rangers outscored the Astros 20-6 over the last two games of the series.
Nathan Eovaldi and Jordan Montgomery accounted for all four wins for the Rangers in the ALCS.
Pre-Game Insights: The Rangers were confident and determined to 'bury' the Astros before Game 7.
Post-Match Reflections: Chris Young praised García's performance and work ethic, stating the team wouldn't be there without him.
Michael Young noted the confidence and determination in the Rangers' clubhouse before Game 7.
Adolis García expressed gratitude for overcoming struggles to reach his current success.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Rangers' turnaround included hiring Bruce Bochy and adding key pitchers through free agency and trades.
The Rangers have an eight-game postseason road winning streak.
Adolis García is one RBI short of the postseason record of 21 RBIs set by David Freese in 2011.
